Anthony Badea

Studying the building blocks of nature

I am interested in studying the higgs boson, inventing new machine learning based analysis techniques, and building microelectronics for fundamental physics. I am a Research Associate at the Enrico Fermi Institute through the Schmidt AI in Science Fellowship. I received my Ph.D. in physics from Harvard University in 2023 and dual B.S. in physics and mathematics from MIT in 2019.

Papers

  • A data-driven and model-agnostic approach to solving combinatorial assignment problems in searches for new physics PRD.
